website_summaries.verdict: When it comes to what skiers want in socks, this pair has it all – reliable warmth, padded comfort, precise fit, and durable wear. You won't find better socks for tackling the slopes.
pros: Stands out for precision stitching that puts padded comfort where skiers need it most – sole, shin, and ankle
5% Spandex keeps them up while 25% wool blend keeps feet warm
The socks also have arch support
cons: Some reports of them shrinking a little after washing
Top portion may fit some wearers a bit on the tight side

customer_reviews.title: PureAthlete
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED. So this company makes more than one version of a ski sock. I originally purchased these and found them to be thin compared to other ski socks. PureAthlete stepped up to the plate and sent me 4 of their THICK ski socks and they are the best I have had so far. No stray threads. Overall comfort A+ Perhaps they should mention their sock options but they take care of the customer.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Marlborough

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: When I spend time outside typically the only part of me that gets cold are my feet. I just used these for the first time while slinging boxes for a couple hours outside in -7 F weather. My shoes had turned into icicles, and yet somehow my feet were still warm. I only had the one pair of socks on. I can't wait to see how my feet hold up while wearing a pair of properly insulated boots as well!
customer_reviews.author: lightbody82

customer_reviews.title: Great for skiing and snowboarding
customer_reviews.text: I liked how thin and warm they were. I used them to ski twice already. When using with ski boots, you really don't want a sock to bunch up or be too thick as it will cause blisters. That was not the case with these socks. These socks were all around perfect. I may even buy some more for my son and daughter who are starting to shred some snow with me too!
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN SNYDER

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sock for skiing or winter boots!
customer_reviews.text: These were the first ski socks I've purchased that kept my toes warm (I always have cold toes and usually use warmers) and stay tight (but not too tight) against my shin all day. I live in Colorado and ski about once or twice a week during season and these socks are absolutely perfect. I've ended up ordering more and wear them with my Sorels when the heavy stuff shows up.
customer_reviews.author: Steve-O

customer_reviews.title: About to head out to the mountains and put these ...
customer_reviews.text: About to head out to the mountains and put these socks to the test! Will update later in the day or tomorrow! (: Update: Went skiing for about 6 hours and when I got home and took off all my gear, I was so happy to see that after taking the socks off, they WERE DRY. It was my first time out on the mountain and FELL VARIOUS TIMES, but was so happy to see that the socks NEVER soaked water in (: DEFINITELY RECOMMEND!!
customer_reviews.author: Laura B

customer_reviews.title: Great Winter Sport Socks
customer_reviews.text: These were great while skiing, snowmobiling and snow tubing! Kept my feet warm and dry. They are a little snug if you have large or muscular calves and didn't stretch as much as some of the other socks I bought, but they were still pretty comfortable. Great padding at key stress areas..
customer_reviews.author: Zadira

customer_reviews.title: Am I Missing Something?
customer_reviews.text: These socks worked well for me during a cold weekend of intermediate-level skiing. My experience was pretty much what I've always had with a wool-blend sock. I'm not so sure about the claims of "arch support" and "sewn in padded areas" in these socks. After one washing, they're pretty "pilled", and holding them side-by-side with the "three pairs for <$20" socks worn by other members of the family, I honestly can't tell anything "special" about the composition of these socks. Nothing wrong with them, but comparatively expensive and I must be missing something about the "special features".
customer_reviews.author: PensFifthCup

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and warm.  They come up a long way and don't seem to fall.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed wearing this this last skiing trip of the season. They provided the warmth I wanted, but also were thin enough to help me not be in a lot of pain by the end of the day. They still caused some discomfort, but that is not really at the fault of the sock. I have very large calves and boots often cause me discomfort, if not lasting pain, due to the socks getting pressed so hard into my calves. In the end, I'd definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob & Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Love these socks!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! The PureAthlete Wool Skiing Snowboard Socks are great ski socks! They are soft - not itchy or scratchy and they keep your feet warm while skiing. These socks are not as thin as the PureAthlete Warm Skiing Socks, they are just a little thicker, but not bulky. These are also a little warmer than PureAthlete Warm Skiing Socks. The PureAthlete Wool Skiing Snowboard Socks are also great for just wearing around when it is cold. I am 5'8" inches and weigh 150 pounds and wear a women's size 9 shoe - the Medium fit perfectly. I like that they reach all the way to my knee and don't fall down.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Ann in Anacortes

customer_reviews.title: Great Ski Socks - so much better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: These socks were fantastic! I bought two bulk packs and gave a couple of pairs to each person on our ski trip. Everyone loved how comfy and soft the socks were. Then we skied in them and realized they have a lot of great technology to boot! Each pair has a LEFT and RIGHT foot, with padded areas to keep your shins and ankle bones comfy in the ski boots. They stayed dry and comfortable all day (except for the boarders who got wet boots!) and didn't slide down our legs, despite many different sizes of calves in our group. I was 100% pleased with these socks and the shipping was fast. I highly recommend the socks and the vendor!
customer_reviews.author: D. Settle

customer_reviews.title: Best ski socks I've ever had!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one pair to try them out. I wore them skiing and they were super comfortable and worked well with my boots. Some ski socks that I have tried have actually make my ski boots hurt my shin, but these wonderful socks didn't. I was in total comfort all day long skiing in Whitefish. I washed them, and they were still great, so I order two more pair! I also love pink, and the combination of the grey and pink were fantastic--it doesn't make them function any better, but it does make me happy!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Judy

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but...
customer_reviews.text: The socks are very comfy and fit well. I tried them in boots rated for -40F in a 32F weather. After 45 min of inactivity, feet got cold. They are too thin to keep feet warm at low temperatures. They definitely will not keep your feet warm all day unless you move every 30 min. That makes them expensive at that price since they don't keep your feet warm which is the main reason you are spending $22 on a pair of socks.
customer_reviews.author: Shark1080

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, value for money
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Keeps very warm. Used it inside snowboots in dead of winter in Iceland. My kids used the same and they never complained about "cold feet" (My little one usually feels cold very quickly!). Very soft. Reached up to knees for adult (5 ft 6inch tall). SUPER BUY for extreme winters!
customer_reviews.author: k AMika-Z

customer_reviews.title: Excellent socks. Very warm.
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent socks. My teen son has been wearing them snowboarding - they're perfect. Tested in tough weather, too - he had them on when the weather turned to pouring freezing rain. His words "those socks saved my feet". He wears a size 8 shoe in gym shoes, got these in size S and they fit great. Wash and dry just fine, no shrinking or issues. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Musicbookfan

customer_reviews.title: Good ski socks fit well and function well
customer_reviews.text: I ski at least every year or two and have accumulated a fair number of pairs of ski socks. These looked interesting and I gave them a try and they are now my favorite pair. They kept my feet warm in zero to a few degrees sub-zero and they worked well. Did my feet rver get cold? Yes, they did. I have not found socks yet where you don't have a little cold feet after skiing 5-6 hours straight. But they performed well enough that I plan on buying two or three more pairs. Didn't try foot warmers as they seem to be more discomfort than is worth the added warmth. Socks did well. Solid 4 of 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher C

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $22
customer_reviews.text: I live in Utah and ski a lot. My old Smartwool socks were worn out so I bought these. I was on the slopes all day today, snowing and 17 degrees. My toes were cold. These socks are only 25% wool and thin. Note that the socks are marked with a L and R for the proper feet.
customer_reviews.author: Armondo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sock!
customer_reviews.text: I have had the opportunity to try these socks out for 3 sessions now. Temps were: 42F, 30F, and 22F. The socks performed wonderfully all three days. They replaced a very old pair of Oakley snowboard socks I had been using since I started snowboarding 5 or so years. They served me well but were at the end of their serviceable life. I was anxious to replace them as they have worked so well for me for so long. I am happy to report that the pure athlete socks are worlds above my previous socks. They are highly cushioned but not obtrusively so. They are very warm without numbing the feel in my snowboard boot. Very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: r. Woodrich

customer_reviews.title: Warm, Soft and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I am very particular about what socks I wear. Usually Smart Wool or Darn Tough. I bought these to take to Antartica to wear in muck boots. It was a warm summer inn Antartica 36 degrees most days, but still kayaking and walking over snow could be cold and my feet stayed toasty warm when others had cool feet. The socks were soft and comfortable and fit true to size. Delivery was quick and the price was excellent. I will wear these cross country skiing now as well. Highly recommend these socks.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Socks were disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these socks for a ski trip. First, the socks were not the bright royal blue pictured. They were actually quite dull in color. Second, the socks were thin and not padded in the contact points as the description implies. I wanted padding where my shins always rub up against the ski boots. I have ordered other brands in the past that have much more padding than these socks. I won't be ordering these again.
customer_reviews.author: KatyConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Socks
customer_reviews.text: I am a ski instructor at Copper Mountain and am out in all kinds of conditions. These socks are very warm and comfortable. I would recommend these socks to any of my students or other ski instructors. They are fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: kelly VanGeet

customer_reviews.title: No shin bang!
customer_reviews.text: I tried several other padded ski socks but they always left me bruised after a run down the slopes. These socks were padded in all the right places! They've been through several washings (cold water, delicate cycle, then line dry) an still hold their form and function. I have found THE SKI SOCK and will be ordering more next ski season!
customer_reviews.author: Kagomeh

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced - same technology and performance as $10-12 socks.
customer_reviews.text: Actual wool content is only 25% - but they are titled “high performance wool socks”. The “high performance” mostly happens in your head - the main difference from similar products is in clever marketing enlightened by data mining and psychology research.
customer_reviews.author: serge7m

customer_reviews.title: NIce (but expensive)
customer_reviews.text: Nice socks if you're not worried about price. The different spots on the socks around the heal, arches and toes are different knitting - meaning tighter in some spots and padded in others . I've worn them both skiing and boarding 10x and they're holding up nicely. Much better than the Under Armor socks I was using.
customer_reviews.author: woody

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Ive had many pairs of ski/snowboard sock in the past . These are fine and they work . After using them for a few days on the mountain they already seem to be stretching out a bit (not keeping their form around the calf area) The overall stitching and construction is ok but I have socks that cost a few dollars more that seem to be a lot better quality. I have had other brand ski socks that hold up for multiple seasons and Although this particular pair in question Are not terrible by any means they seem like they might not last as long (time will tell)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be fooled!!!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t be bamboozled! This is a low quality, well marketed, add buy product. This is being pushed as quality, but it is not. Does not compare to socks half the price. This is cheap Chinese garbage in a shiny “box” (actually comes in cellophane). The tech and features are gross exaggerations. I have ski socks of all ranges and this is on the very, very low end. Might be worth $5. Definitely not $20. Don’t get swindled like me. Thumbs down. Oops.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great Socks!!!
customer_reviews.text: These socks are great, so warm and comfortable. They stay up, do not fall down. Got the pink and really like them. I will definitely buy them again. Live in a cold climate and am always cold, so these socks are perfect for me. They are also a good value. ; - )
customer_reviews.author: Pearl S. Buck

customer_reviews.title: Sizing Chart is Way Off
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't write reviews but feel it is necessary with these socks given the cost of these socks. I wear a size 10 men's and chose the medium size based on their sizing chart. The ankle padding in 2 to 3 inches above the ankle; therefore, the padding over the ankle in no existent for a size 10 foot. If you try to ski with the shoes you are guaranteed getting a blister. These socks are NOT worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: stonewall

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't wear them with my Ski boots
customer_reviews.text: I really like the fit of these but they have a bunch of sewing bunches that make the socks lumpy. Normally this wouldn't be a big deal but with really tight ski boots they start pushing against your muscles. I ended up getting a shin cramp because of it.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler

customer_reviews.title: Feels awesome on shins!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 pair of these socks for my ski trip to Colorado this year. Socks came in and have been great. Skied a couple days in single digits and feet were cold, but not freezing.. I will end up buying a couple more pairs of these socks. My shins felt great after 8 hrs of hitting the slopes hard. First socks that didn't leave imprints in my calf.
customer_reviews.author: jared

customer_reviews.title: Want toasty feet?
customer_reviews.text: These socks are by far my favorite to go boarding with. I have regular thick wool socks which I use to double up when I went boarding and my feet would still get cold. These socks don't feel as thick but they keep my feet warm all day on the slopes. No doubling up socks or anything. I especially love how they come up right below my knees to provide maximum comfort with my boots on. I recommend these socks even for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Great warm socks for skiing
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! No complaints! Wore skiing twice this season and toes were nice and toasty. I also didn’t experience as much shin pain, but that might have been all in my head. Either way, this is my second purchase of this item for a friend and they loved it too
customer_reviews.author: Charlise

customer_reviews.title: Keeps feet warm on bitter cold days...
customer_reviews.text: A thinner but warm sock the my husband likes. It kept his feet warm on -35 degree days. I will be ordering more. The design is good,too! This is an update. My husband was so impressed with this sock that he requested I order another pair for him. He also told me to get a pair for myself. I just received mine yesterday and have not tried them. I love the color. It makes me happy:)
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine C.

customer_reviews.title: Husband approved!
customer_reviews.text: My husband hates socks that fall and he needed some new wool socks (he works at night and sometimes outside). He requested only one thing: They are knee-height so they don't fall. He wears 10.5 shoes and I got the large for Christmas. He loves them so much that he requested I buy more so he could throw away all his other wool socks. I bought a 6-pack and he's very excited!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gracy Castleman

customer_reviews.title: Great socks for Ski Patrollers
customer_reviews.text: Used the socks this week. They are padded perfectly. As Ski Patrollers in Vermont my wife and I are in our ski boots from 7:30 am to 5 pm The socks are warm and your feet are dry all day no matter how hard you are working on the mountain. I plan on ordering 6 more pair
customer_reviews.author: Bob —patrol 29

customer_reviews.title: Warm Socks ... to warm your heart!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these wool ski socks for my "professional" grade skier/snowboarder/snow shoe-er ... daughter. She was very happy with the style and they were WARM! Great socks!
customer_reviews.author: MaMaaz

customer_reviews.title: Nice ski socks
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for me and my daughter to wear. They were comfortable, except the design on the shin needs to be in the right place when putting on the ski boots or it will hurt. Wash up well and like the design a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Franxswife

customer_reviews.title: Great ski sock for me. I wear a shoe size 13 mens so Large fit me.
customer_reviews.text: Wore them skiing this year. The socks never sagged or never slid down in my ski boot. Fit perfect and no sagging yet 3 pairs, different color so it easy to rotate socks. they have different thickness socks these are what I call middle thickness, not to thin not to thick, good quality, would work in almost any conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Pitsch

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed and definitely not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: After one washing, the socks were in bad shape. I have socks I wear with my hunting boots that last for years. These I wore once, washed and they shrunk and had began to fray. I'll never purchase again. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: claydeer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 10 and 13 y/o for Ski vacation  Size Small.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 3 pair combo in size small for a snowboarding trip to Whistler. Size Small fit my 10 year old Size 4.5 and my 13 y/o size 6.5 perfectly. Snowboarded literally all day everyday for a week and never had issues with cold feet. Comfy, good quality, held up good after several washes.
customer_reviews.author: Eddy P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance Merino blend padded ski sock.
customer_reviews.text: These Merino blend socks not only offer a perfect level of warmth, but also feature strategic placed padding helping relieve such issues as shin bang. I have always skied with boot heaters, and so prefer slimmer design sock such as these. The socks are true to size, however they do have a high-rise.
customer_reviews.author: Adam M

customer_reviews.title: great for my first time skiing
customer_reviews.text: really liked the compression of these socks, my feet were sweaty afterwards but never cold. covered my whole calf and protected me from the ski boots. glad i bought these before my trip.
customer_reviews.author: dk

customer_reviews.title: Performs as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I've only owned these socks for 1 week and bought them to go skiing. I've only worn them once so I can't comment on durability but the socks were very comfortable, warm, and I really liked the price.
customer_reviews.author: VTParadox

customer_reviews.title: They are decent.  I'd get a higher quality sock if I did it all over again.
customer_reviews.text: Not a true Merino wool sock. Knitting is pulling after only a few uses. Fit is ok. I tried a friend's ski sock that was from a name brand and was blown away by the difference.
customer_reviews.author: J. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Stay dry and warm!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these socks for my husband. He used to ski, so he is familiar with this type of sock and wears them to work. He is always complaining that his feet get sweaty, and then when he goes back outside they freeze. I bought him a pair of these. He loves them! He said his feet don't sweat at all in these, and they are really warm and comfortable. He liked them so much I bought him two more pairs. These socks are really worth the price for his happy feet!
customer_reviews.author: AmandaM

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy socks with worthless warranty!
customer_reviews.text: I wore these ski socks for the 2nd time and they developed a 2 inch rip in the ball of the foot. I now see they are saying the return window ended January 31st—and it’s now February 25. Do yourself a favor and buy socks with a decent return policy—like “ Darn Tough “ socks that have a lifetime guarantee.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Mcclellan

customer_reviews.title: You cant miss these.  Perfect for the cold.
customer_reviews.text: I love these socks. These are perfect when you are out exercising in the cold. I don't snowboard. But, I know cold weather protection. And these are 100% real. I am purchasing another pair right away.
customer_reviews.author: dahl

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best socks I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Don't hesitate to buy these. Amazing comfort and performance. I bought another pair after trying them out the first time. I'm sure to buy some more as well. Just terrific.
customer_reviews.author: edwarddwoodjr

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and warm
customer_reviews.text: Product shipped to me fast. Took them out on the slopes yesterday and I was not disappointed whatsoever. In 3 degree weather and a -37 wind chill at the top of the mountain, my feet were none the wiser. So comfy, so warm, and my shins don’t hurt at all today from the ski boots. Super impressed and totally worth the extra money for a pair of socks. Will recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy C

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These socks are very comfortable and they kept my feet and calves warm. I wore them running when it was around 35 degrees out, my feet were toasty the whole way. I will say they are a tad tight on my calves, but my legs are very muscular so I expected that. I would but them again.
customer_reviews.author: Blademaster103

customer_reviews.title: Want warm feet while skiing - get these!
customer_reviews.text: Hubby just wore them skiing in northern Michigan. Temps were at least -14 below zero and not including the wind chill. NO COLD FEET! Yay! He is very happy with this product and would recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: Gram T.

customer_reviews.title: So warm and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: L and R sock, my feet stayed warm on the slopes for sure. I’ll even wear them around the house for added warmth. My ankles got a little red from the rubbing of ski boots but would have been worse had I not worn them.
customer_reviews.author: Radtechie

customer_reviews.title: Warm socks
customer_reviews.text: Going to the mountains for snow time? Buy these... little pricey, but worth it. If you will be in snow for any length of time, you may want to put a regular sock under for added warmth. They are over the calf, which I like, and they stay up.
customer_reviews.author: J from South Texas

customer_reviews.title: Great ski socks, great value. Bought them for the entire family.
customer_reviews.text: Soft, warm, great fit. Better value than expected. Used them the first time in Park City recently. 20 to 30 degree weather and 20k+ vertical feet a day of skiing. Loved the socks.
customer_reviews.author: Tony B.

customer_reviews.title: NICE Design
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to wear with my equestrian riding boots. They aren't bulky and really help keep my feet and toes warm on cold winter days. Never had a pair of socks before that with designated sock for each foot. Have worn them several times already and plan on buying another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Emmy

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a good product. Fit as expected
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a good product. Fit as expected, I bought a medium and wear a men's 10.5 shoe. I have used them 3 times (skiing) and they appear to be pilling a bit. Given they are new, it is hard to suggest durability, but I am also still using 10 year old ski socks that have not pilled at all, thus I am suggesting 4 stars given the unknown durability and early pilling. They were certainly warm, comfortable, and supportive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect winter socks
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughter for a skiing trip. She loves them
customer_reviews.author: suzanne cotton

customer_reviews.title: Great for this price point
customer_reviews.text: Great product and great service. The socks are thin but warm and fit as expected. I wore them skiing right after I got them, and washed them. They seem to keep their shape. I think they were great for this price point.
customer_reviews.author: I'm Just Sayin'

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and cute!
customer_reviews.text: First pair of ski socks I have ever purchased. My feet were nice and warm and did not sweat when I skied for first time last week. Very happy with the socks and ver cute color and design! Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: TanCatLuvr

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my feet warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've worn these three times snowboarding and they have performed flawlessly. I've only used them for roughly four hours at a time but my feet have stayed warm and the cushioning feels great. But a second pair after trying these out.
customer_reviews.author: Southernguy

customer_reviews.title: Great socks for skiing!
customer_reviews.text: We just got back from our ski trip and I have to say, these were great! The extra padding on the shin and ankle bone really helped protect the ski boots from rubbing and bruising. They kept our feet dry and warm our whole time skiing. I will be buying more for our future ski trips.
customer_reviews.author: LovetoShop

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these for casual wear
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase! The socks are very comfortable and they are keeping my feet warm in my boots today. I suffer from chronically cold toes and am always looking for low-tech ways to keep my feet comfy. Not really planning on wearing these for winter sport purposes but I imagine they'd work very well for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: TermsandConditions

customer_reviews.title: Great socks
customer_reviews.text: I don't ski or snowboard, but my feet still get cold. These socks are super comfy. They don't slide down and they keep my 79-year-old feet WARM.
customer_reviews.author: Granny Geek

customer_reviews.title: Comfy & Warm
customer_reviews.text: Bought these socks for my grandsons for Christmas. They took them to CO on ski holiday and they said their feet were comfy and toasty warm! Their mom and dad borrowed a pair to try and they loved them as well. Bravo!
customer_reviews.author: Barbi D

customer_reviews.title: I like them!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that they come to my knees and I have fairly long legs and they have stayed up all day. I didn't need to keep pulling them up. It's not terribly cold out so I don't know about warmth yet.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: great everyday winter socks
customer_reviews.text: socks stay up and in place with boots on good in cold weather but not extremely cold weather and defiantly not warm when feet are wet
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pair for my dad, and he is clearly happy with them. He said they fit perfectly well and keep his feet really warm in the cold nights. I recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Peralta

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: These aren’t as warm as I was expecting. I ended up switching back to some other wool socks I have while snowboarding.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie32182

customer_reviews.title: Not as warm as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would be the solution to my frequent cold-feet issues, but seem to keep my feet as warm as my previous $5 pair of ski socks from Marchall's. Feet are still cold on most days. They are a decent ski sock, but nothing exceptionally warm as they advertised, and probably not worth the $20 I spent on them.
customer_reviews.author: All Things Strings

customer_reviews.title: These socks are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I will be purchasing at least one more pair before next ski season! Very warm but not thick and bulky!
customer_reviews.author: Rolson

customer_reviews.title: I mean they're good but...
customer_reviews.text: They are a good pair of socks. There isn't a huge upgrade from normal winter socks to these snow socks. You're spending 20$ on a pair of socks when you can get a 3 pack of these for half the price. But I don't regret buying these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cool looking, odd construction
customer_reviews.text: I like the color options. The socks run somewhat big. The transitions between colors have a ridge that rubs in ski boots. Is it really necessary to have a labeled left and right sock?
customer_reviews.author: jmumv

customer_reviews.title: but so far the best hardboot snowboarding sock I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: My size 9 1/2 foot fit into a large perfectly. For such a well padded / insulated sock my feet were warm but did not overheat, riding in spring conditions. I have not used them in true winter conditions yet, but so far the best hardboot snowboarding sock I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems not durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought one last year, and after last winter sport use, it has a bit hole. This time, I bought one to my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger, Hsu

customer_reviews.title: Nice Socks!!!
customer_reviews.text: These socks are great but, I think I must’ve overlooked they are kids socks because the medium is too small for a man with size 8-9 shoe size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t had a chance to wear these yet (got them for an upcoming trip to Colorado) but they seem like great quality and they are as pictured
customer_reviews.author: CH2014

customer_reviews.title: Thin and tight socks
customer_reviews.text: I have only worn these socks once so far and I liked them. They are pretty thin, so don’t buy them if you are looking for thicker ski socks. They are also pretty tight. The first day I wore them, I thought my boots were too small, but I think it was just because it was my first time wearing the socks and I may have been loosing a little circulation in my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Wright

customer_reviews.title: great comfort and value
customer_reviews.text: extremely comfortable and great at warming the feet. zero issues with circulation in my right skis. great value!
customer_reviews.author: sweetz1023hp

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: High quality socks for a great price. Used these on a few snowboarding trips and they are holding up well. Very comfortable, durable and warm. They definitely get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: MarcusMiller6158

customer_reviews.title: Super warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Reviews were correct. These kept my feet warm, and comfortable. I love skiing in these. Feel good in my boots. Thin is better than thick for me in my ski boots. Easy on.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Galanty

customer_reviews.title: Good ski sock at good price
customer_reviews.text: Happy with socks and using with Atomic Hawx 130S ski boots. Socks provide good warmth, comfort, fit at good price. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Smith

customer_reviews.title: Warm
customer_reviews.text: These socks are great fit is perfect. The padding is right where it works the best. Very warm well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great socks for daily use.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent..they keep my feet warm all day...I use them for work...they feel a little tight around the calf muscle area...especially if you have muscular legs. I fold the socks down over my ankles for support. I love the snug support for my ankles. Great socks for cold days at work.
customer_reviews.author: Moon Mountain

customer_reviews.title: Great ski socks but pricy if not bought in bulk
customer_reviews.text: Warm and comfortable these ski socks worked great for our trip. Wish the color combinations could be changed because buying in this “bulk” set is way cheaper than buying lower quantities.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton G. Grumbles

customer_reviews.title: If you want a warm sock...!
customer_reviews.text: It is a great sock. I am a downhill ski instructor (in Wisconsin) so I need tough warm socks. As an instructor I want a very close boot fit so I can feel the molded foot beds under my feet. This sock is a little thick on the foot portion but for most people that would not be a problem. If you want warm feet when you're outside in the winter this is the sock for you.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Milfred

customer_reviews.title: Actually keeps your feet warm.
customer_reviews.text: This sock is amazing. Compared to the Carhartt winter sock this one actually keeps my feet warm. I believe it does this by improving circulation. It is thinner than the Carhartt sock yet does a better job.
customer_reviews.author: George F. Serr

customer_reviews.title: truly high performance
customer_reviews.text: While I am far from the mountains, I do love ski socks. They are long enough to cover my calves...and not slip down around my ankles. Unlike more traditional winter wool socks with "fluffy" interiors, these socks are thin, yet warm and comfortable. I wore them for 30-40 hours before washing them and was never disappointed with them, nor did they smell...more over, they did not share the smell of my feet with the world. Without a doubt...my new cold weather sock. I might even go skiing!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Elrod

customer_reviews.title: Bought a second pair
customer_reviews.text: Had an issue with the first pair I purchased and seller immediately made it right
customer_reviews.author: C. Ferrara

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sock for skiing
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sock for skiing. Love the extra padding up front. Perfect for my use case where I prefer a light/moderate thickness sock.
customer_reviews.author: ShelteredExistence

customer_reviews.title: All around ok
customer_reviews.text: Their basically good socks but not really for cold temps. Took mine out this morning and it was 32 here . With heavy boots and these socks my feet still froze . I'd buy for comfort comfortability but not cold. Still a good sock tho
customer_reviews.author: willie levart

customer_reviews.title: These socks keep your feet warm.
customer_reviews.text: I wear these more for a daily winter sock in our cold weather. Have had them for about 3-4 months and they wear well, keep my feet warm, not scratchy and they stay put at the top of the sock. I think they would be great for skiing or snowboarding or other outdoor activities.
customer_reviews.author: thedogmom

customer_reviews.title: These are nice
customer_reviews.text: Well made socks, vivid colors. They are almost a compression sock.
customer_reviews.author: Flash

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality
customer_reviews.text: High quality. Gave them out at the holidays. Great under tall boots.
customer_reviews.author: H. H.

customer_reviews.title: Great ski socks!
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, run true to size. Great quality and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: It’s good for the money. It does keep you warm and does not bunch up in your ski boot. When washed, it does create lint balls.
customer_reviews.author: J Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Great Socks
customer_reviews.text: I love these socks. They are so comfortable and warm. My little tootsies have never been happier in the winter months.
customer_reviews.author: Ben W

customer_reviews.title: Best socks for skiing, ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: These ski socks fit perfectly and cushion the shin area and all the important areas of the foot. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Myra Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: Great socks
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband for our ski trip and they worked perfectly. His feet stayed warm and dry and they aren’t bulky so he was comfortable too. Loved them.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Denton

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and warm
customer_reviews.text: Fix is on spot. Socks stay up. Seem to be built with good quality light compression keep sock n place compression not noticeable though. I'm ordering more as I wrote this. There of the same quality as Euro brand ski socks. I'm impressed I hope they last longer than the euros did
customer_reviews.author: Paul Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and warm
customer_reviews.text: First time using these and they performed as expected. Skiing in temps from 1 to 17 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney F.

customer_reviews.title: All-day ski/MTB/outback sock
customer_reviews.text: I’m a bit of a shoe sock foot snob... I ask a lot from my sport or outdoor foot wear/care/utility. I really like the placement of the extra padding where needed and comfortable and seemingly sturdy thin....ness where padding needs to be minimum to allow for free movement.
customer_reviews.author: Billygoat

product_meta.title: High Performance Wool Ski Socks – Outdoor Winter Men Women Sock Merino Snowboard
feature_bullets: PREMIUM MERINO WOOL FOR ENHANCED WARMTH – Our innovative blend of merino wool and polypropylene wicks moisture away while maintaining the foots natural temperature to prevent the ski socks from feeling too warm. Made of 54% Nylon, 25% Merino Wool, 16% Polypropelene, 5% Spandex.

ULTIMATE COMFORT WHILE SKIING, MIDWEIGHT THICKNESS - Advanced knitting techniques provide key comfort areas. Cushioning in the shin, ankle, and the foot areas to ensure the ultimate comfort and prevent any discomfort when worn with ski boots. The socks feature midweight thickness, making them an ideal downhill / cross country ski sock. Use for any cold weather outdoor activity to keep feet warm.
ARCH SUPPORT: An elastic arch support provides comfort and helps to reduce fatigue in the feet while skiing.
SKI SOCKS STAY UP: The wool ski socks feature an elastic at the top to prevent the ski socks from sliding down, ensuring the stay in place all day while you are on the slopes

GUARANTEED FOR LIFE and BUY FROM A TRUSTED AMERICAN COMPANY: At Pure Athlete, we are experts in socks. We are manufacturers of many of the bestselling skiing, hiking, and running socks. Our company is over 6 years old. Don’t take our word for it, read our customer reviews and try our running socks. We know you will love them or your money back. We back all our products by a 100% satisfaction money back guarantee.
